vague_description: A repairman is trying to determine the optimal number of washing machines and freezers to repair based on time constraints and potential earnings.
detailed_description: A repairman fixes washing machines and freezers. Each washing machine takes \param{InspectionTimeWashingMachine} minutes of inspection and \param{FixingTimeWashingMachine} minutes of fixing time. Each freezer takes \param{InspectionTimeFreezer} minutes of inspection and \param{FixingTimeFreezer} minutes of fixing time. The repairman has \param{TotalInspectionTime} minutes available for inspection and \param{TotalFixingTime} minutes available in his schedule. If each washing machine repaired earns him \param{EarningsWashingMachine} and each freezer repaired earns him \param{EarningsFreezer}, how many of each appliance should he fix to maximize his earnings?
target_objective: Maximize the repairman's earnings from fixing washing machines and freezers
target_constraints: Number of washing machines fixed is non-negative
Number of freezers fixed is non-negative
The total inspection time for all appliances does not exceed TotalInspectionTime minutes
The total fixing time for all appliances does not exceed TotalFixingTime minutes
target_parameters: Minutes for inspection of a washing machine
Minutes for fixing a washing machine
Minutes for inspection of a freezer
Earnings from repairing a washing machine
